subject: Re: [junit] testing junit
msgSnippet: However, I found that the alterantive link refered by Mike Clark s worked: http://www.clarkware.com/articles/junitprimer.html Good luck! ... From: Andrew Zou
messageBody:
However, I found that the alterantive link refered by Mike Clark's worked: http://www.clarkware.com/articles/junitprimer.html
 
Good luck!
----- Original Message -----
From: Andrew Zou
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:06 AM
Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit

I think this link( http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm) does not work any more. Does any body know the mirror site or they moved this page to where.
 
Thanks.
 
Andrew
-----Original Message-----
From: Philippe Vanpeperstraete [mailto:philippe.vanpeperstraete@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:48 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit

Did you look under the "documentation" tab, there, you'll find the JUnit cookbook, which is a pretty good start, if you get your Java environment straight.
 
regards
Philippe
-----Original Message-----
From: Ram Kumar [mailto:y_ramkumar@...]
Sent: woensdag 30 mei 2001 16:33
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] testing junit

Hi,

I am a new JUnit user and just downloaded JUnit and trying to work with it. I could not find proper documentation about how to install JUnit and use it, in JUnit site.

Could any one suggest me where to find good documentation about JUnit?

Awaiting your immediate reply.

Thanks,

Yamasani.
